text:
period.
These are:
• severe pain on one side, 
low down in the abdomen;
• vaginal bleeding or a brown 
watery discharge;
• pain in your shoulders;
• feeling dizzy or faint;
• pain when you have a 
bowel movement.
If you have any of these 
symptoms and you might be 
pregnant	–	even	if	you	have	
not had a positive pregnancy 
test	–	you	should	see	your	
doctor immediately.
Some women have no obvious 
signs or symptoms at all and 
an ectopic pregnancy may 
sometimes be mistaken for 
irritable bowel
